document.docTitle: Orchestina cornuta Henrard & Jocqué 2012, new species

materialsCitation.collectorName: R. Jocque & K. Loosveldt & L. Baert & M. Alderweireldt

paragraph.materialsCitation:
TYPE: Holotype Male :
Cameroon
, Faro Game Reserve , tropical savanna, canopy, 8.38583°, 12.83333°,
Nov.10, 2006
, R. Jocqué , K. Loosveldt , L. Baert and M. Alderweireldt ( MRAC 228902 PBI _ OON 8987 ).

subSubSection.paragraph: ETYMOLOGY: The specific name refers to the shape of the male endites which are provided with a horn-shaped extension (cornus).

DIAGNOSIS: The male of
O. cornuta
is easily recognized by the endites with a horn-shaped extension and a prolateral row of flattened setae ( Figs. 153, 157 ), the strongly enlarged bulb and the labium with leaf-shaped setae ( Figs. 139 , 158–159 ). The female can be recognized by the stout cylindrical AUS with apical expansions (Pr) and circular arrangement of the dorsolateral extensions (Ex) ( Figs. 149, 150 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 138–143.
Orchestina cornuta ,
new species . 138. Male (Ht, PBI_OON 00008987) habitus, dorsal view. 139. Male (Ht, PBI_OON 00008987), prosoma, ventral view.140. Female (Pt, PBI_OON 00033869), habitus, dorsal view. 141. Same, ventral view. 142. Male (Ht, PBI_OON 00008987), habitus, lateral view. 143. Female (Pt, PBI_OON 00033869), habitus, lateral view.

FIGURES 144–150.
Orchestina cornuta ,
new species . 144. Male (Pt, PBI_OON 00033867) palp, retrolateral view. 145. Same, frontal view. 146. Same, prolateral view. 147. Female (Pt, PBI_OON 00033869) genitalia, ventral view. 148. Female (Pt, PBI_OON 00033868) genitalia, ventral view. 149. Female (Pt, PBI_OON 00033312) genitalia, cleared, dorsal view. 150. Female (Pt, PBI_OON 00033312) genitalia, cleared, dorsal view. ARe: anterior receptaculum; AUS: anterior uterine sclerite; Ex: dorsolateral extension; Pr: lateral protrusion.

FIGURES 151–159.
Orchestina cornuta ,
new species , male (Pt, PBI_OON 00008988). 151. Mouthparts, anterior view. 152. Same, ventral view. 153. Endites and labium, ventral view. 154. Chelicerae, anterior view showing modified setae. 155. Same, lateral view. 156. Same, detail of modified seta. 157. Endites, showing distal horns. 158. Same, anterior view. 159. Labium, ventral view.

subSubSection.paragraph: FEMALE (PBI_OON_0033868). As in male except as noted. Total length 1.34. CEPHALOTHORAX: Carapace ( Figs. 140, 143 ) yellow, broadly oval in dorsal view (CW/CL ≈ 0.78). Sternum ( Fig. 141 ) anterior margin unmodified Mouthparts : Labium anterior margin indented at middle. ABDOMEN ( Figs.140, 141, 143 ): without long posterior extension, rounded posteriorly. Spinnerets not examined. LEGS: patella plus tibia I nearly as long as carapace (TL/CL ≈ 1.06). GENITALIA( Figs. 147–150 ): Ventral view as seen through cuticle: anterior part with strongly sclerotized anvil-shaped structure (AUS), basally with narrow, faint transverse band slightly recurved in centre (Ex); both parts connected by two longitudinal, parallel, opaque, tubular structures (ARe?). Dorsal view: AUS small, cylindrical, anteriorly with two lateral knobs (Pr?), probably fused with ARe at base; ARe visible as two longitudinal, parallel, semitransparent, tubular structures; AUS + ARe surrounded by narrow hoop (Ex), interrupted anteriorly, with widened tips; posterior receptaculum absent.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 160–167.
Orchestina cornuta ,
new species , male (Pt, PBI_OON 00008988). 160. Palp, retrolateral view. 161. Same, frontal view. 162. Embolus tip, retrolateral view. 163. Same, ventral view. 164. Same, dorsal view. 165. Tarsal organ on cymbium. 166. Same, detail. 167. Genital area, ventral view.
